name: Halo - YC Batch '18 (StartupSchool)
description:
Super-local and dedicated to keeping everyone around you in the know, connecting neighbours together for chats.

Currently, we're scaling like crazy, we invite 1,000 users a day across London and are one of the fastest-growing consumer networks in the UK. 

We're putting people together like never before and aim to be the future way for your street's community.

Every community is connected for important updates. Everything from Wifi issues to local safety. 

It's a wild ride.

jobs.title: Mobile Engineer
jobs.description:
What we are looking for:	

A person with a keen appetite for problem-solving and product mindset; above all else, we want someone who is passionate about their local communities and wants to use their skills for the betterment of them. Also, we are constantly evaluating new technologies and solutions for our product – you should be able to learn quickly, be flexible, and take risks.

You will: 
Be given the opportunity to shape and lead all front-end related development processes, structure, and technology. You will work side-by-side with our current Development Team, of course, and interact extremely closely with our interaction Design Team to produce a beautiful, intuitive, and robust platform for our members. We believe strongly in the design process and iteration - so, you will also work directly with our Growth and Community Teams to understand how our members are using the platform to communicate and connect. We are always pushing the limits of our knowledge – you will help push this forward! 

Skills short list: 
- 2 years of working knowledge with React Native
- 2-3 years of working on JavaScript and HTML/CSS on an application with complex front-end 
- Working understanding of JavaScript, CSS, design principles and patterns for front-end development
- Good insight into UI/UX
- Able to communicate and rapidly prototype UX with the Design Team

Bonus points for:
- Experience developing Native mobile apps for iOS or/and Android
- Backend experience and understanding of networking, protocol layers

jobs.title: CS (STEM) Internship
jobs.description:
Job Summary

Graduate Marketing Internship

We're looking for two bright interns for a 6-month internship as we scale our startup. We take all the startup magic from San-Fransisco and use it in building disruption to something we all care about, how safe we feel.

You'll be using your skills to write magnetic content and make data-driven decisions learning the tricks to building a startup and entrepreneurship at breakneck speed. Once you help build out your technology/marketing skills you'll be put in charge of social media to help build the voice of the company in 280 characters.

We'll offer practical tuition across all aspects of marketing and analytics: 
- Content that sticks
- Managing communities
- Setting up and running campaigns both in our marketing estate and the product itself!

The position is flexible with 3 days a week in the office; you'll have a weekly check-in where you'll get one-2-one mentoring on all aspects; when not in day-day you’ll be focused in being on hand directly for the CEO and the hours are flexible.

Our aim is to give you a great hard start over 6 months with potentially the option to extend the Internship to a full year

How to Apply
There is no CV, send one and we won't read it
Apply with a covering letter, here are the rules:

FIRST:
Connect and introduce yourself, tell us something interesting in the first sentence, make it no more than a paragraph

SECOND:

Use a conversational writing style (you don't wear a suit as you type so let's keep it light) and tell us a story about something online in your life. Convey feeling but keep it down to a couple of paragraphs. Use pictures/links that grab our attention.

^ Have some fun, it beats sending another CV to a Recruiter you know won't even remember your name

jobs.title: Distribution / Logistics Co-ordinator
jobs.description:
Halo connects you with people in any area, drop a halo where you live and connect with your street.

Halo's are data-driven they keep you aware of anything that could affect you or your family from crime feeds to upcoming parking restrictions. If your water gets cut off or wifi goes down you'll know if it's you or the whole street!

****Strong organisation skills are a must.****

Daily tasks will include:

Creating efficient processes to onboard thousands of new members on to the platform.
Helping with daily operations and administration, including running introduction for members
Proactively seeking out ways to improve the app and current processes
Managing our Excel sheets and updating them with results
Plotting and mapping out where we make deliveries and onboard users
Update Excel with our latest figures
Use map software to choose streets for marketing
Bundling of paper and marketing for delivery teams
Answering and handling delivery team queries through WhatsApp or Slack
Job requirements

Excellent attention to detail - ***This is the most important requirement****
A 2.1 degree as a minimum from a good university
Excellent written and spoken communication skills
Very good Microsoft Excel skills - you will be updating sheets with data from our products on a daily basis
Excellent organisational and self-management skills with a strong work ethic (this is a fast paced and demanding role, at times, you will need to be flexible in your working hours)
Previous experience in a young startup, recruitment or marketing would be beneficial
Must have worked in an office environment before
6 months - 1-year office administration experience
Benefits

A great starting salary of between 19,000 - 25,000
Amazing offices in Victoria
Lots of responsibility early on, and the chance to grow and progress with a flourishing startup
Job Type: Full-time

Salary: £19,000.00 to £25,000.00 /year

jobs.title: Marketing / Growth Lead
jobs.description:
This role is responsible for getting growing our product out in the market and own pretty much everything from market research to what happens when a user hits our site: conversion, page optimizations, user funnels, discount strategies, pricing strategies, checkout optimization, on-site testing, mobile v. desktop experience optimization, UX optimizations and much more. You will:

- Use customer and competitive research to develop product positioning, messaging and value propositions 
- Builder of our communities and maintaining a relationship with customers as they interact in new kind of network (not DAU, it's all about quality over quantity)
- Define objectives, track progress, measure impact, and use your research to influence how we grow our product and customer base 
- Run tests, talk to users, analyze feedback, and integrate learnings into each subsequent campaign 
- Manage growth campaigns (paid and unpaid) and come up with experiments to refine acquisition channels and optimize conversion funnels 
- Maintain consultant/agency relationships while also identifying where we should bring expertise in-house 
- Develop new acquisition, engagement and retention programs (e.g. mailers, referral, radio, etc) 
- Use and implement analytics (Google, Mixpanel, Flurry etc) to improve future campaigns and help keep everyone updated with what’s happening 
- Report on marketing performance, with a focus on CAC, ROI and customer growth

Key Responsibilities

Amplify and build our brand through impactful marketing initiatives. In this role, you will be responsible for leading all efforts to create engaging and value-generating experiences. You will drive the strategy and execution of Halo's marketing programs while working close to the CEO and leading a small team.

- Work with internal teams and customers to help define, develop, and deliver marketing campaigns for our key initiatives. 
- Use of requisite marketing channels, including content, PPC, SEO. 
- Gatekeeper of brand perception and owner of owned channels (website, social etc.) 
- Work with a diverse cross-functional team to identify root issues and develop cohesive, long-term strategies that leverage the best of Halo 
- Ensure that the cross-company efforts connect to clear and powerful narratives that resonate with key audiences. 
- Strong analytical and communication skills; ability to work with unstructured information and data to influence business decisions. 
- Drive ad hoc projects that require strategic leadership and quick attention, including retargeting campaigns, white papers, offline events, creative briefs, architecture development, and challenges that don’t fit neatly in existing guidance. 
- Building and managing a high-performing marketing team 
- Keeper of a calendar and narrative arc and overall brand perception 
- Respect, empower and enable the creatives that work in your team to let the soul of Halo shine through to our customers. We believe it's the SOUL that ultimately moves the numbers!

Qualifications

- 4-5 years experience marketing to Founders, Investors, and Startup Ecosystems 
- Resourceful, flexible, entrepreneurial at heart, and laser-focused on KPIs. 
- Proven track record success in senior marketing roles 
- Proven work experience as a Content Writer, Copywriter or similar role 
- Excellent writing and editing skills in English 
- Ensure all-around consistency (style, fonts, images and tone) 
- A confident, driven, and dynamic leader 
- Strong project and people management skills, client/partnership experience, strategic orientation, and quantitative/analytical aptitude.

Compensation/Benefits

• Full-time salaried position 
• Unlimited holidays 
• Weekly lunches and snacks provided in the office 
• Mission-driven culture, we believe that everything you do should matter
